page.title: 06Cherrycroft Cottage page 1
page.content: Mrs. Meller lives at Cherrycroft Cottage. The cottage is so called because there was a cherry orchard on the land opposite, which is were now our school playground is now situated. The orchard once belonged to the Bishop of Winchester. It is thorght that Cherrycoft Cottage is about 500 years old. Cherrycroft Cottage was built as two Cottages for two farm labourers and their families. the building of the cottages with the construction of a big chimney stack with a bread oven on either side. The wall of the Cottage are timber framed, filled with wattle and daub. The fram work was laid out horizontally on the church field next to the cottage. It was then hoisted into an upright position and moved to the site. The size of the room was measured by a goad.
